Defining Environment

Source: vignettes/00-defining-environment.Rmd
00-defining-environment.Rmd

In order to reproduce the results of this project we need to follow the following steps to run the code using the same environment:

  1. Install docker by installing Docker Desktop or just Docker Engine if your is linux is your operating system. In Manjaro, you can install it using the next command to install the Docker Engine:
sudo pacman -S docker
  1. Start the docker by opening the Docker Desktop or running the systemctl start command for docker.service based on the systemd packeage.
sudo systemctl start docker.service
  1. To avoid using sudo with each docker command, you can add yourself to the docker group.
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
newgrp docker
  1. Download the image related with this problem.
docker pull angelfelizr/project.nyc.taxi:0.0.99
  1. Change to a directory where you want to save the project. You can see the path by running the next command.
pwd
  1. Create a directory to save the package cache related to the project.
mkdir cache_4.3
  1. Download the repo by running git clone or downloading as a zip.
git clone https://github.com/AngelFelizR/project.nyc.taxi.git
  1. After creating both folders we can run the our container by running the next command based on your working directory.
docker run -d --rm -ti \
    --name project \
    -p 8787:8787 \
    -v  [your_working_dir]/cache_4.3:/home/rstudio/.cache/R/renv/cache/v5/R-4.3/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu \
    -v [your_working_dir]:/home/rstudio \
    angelfelizr/project.nyc.taxi:0.0.99

  1. Then you can go to your favorite browser and go to localhost:8787.

  2. Click over ~/project.nyc.taxi/project.nyc.taxi.Rproj to open the project.

  3. Install the package used:

renv::restore()
  1. To reproduce the analysis presented we have to alternatives:
  • Using the function devtools::build_rmd() to render each article without install the library.
devtools::build_rmd("vignettes/01-data-collection-process.Rmd")
  • Installing the library local library to be able to run the code in an interactive session.
devtools::install_local()
  1. If you want to keep running the container you can kill it.
docker container kill project

Developed by Angel Feliz.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.9.
